intro: Croton chimboracensis, commonly known as the Andean croton, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking, colorful leaves that often display a range of red, yellow, and green hues. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique botanical features such as milky sap. It typically grows in high-altitude regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine, though its ornamental value is also significant in horticulture.
